greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=1; thereafter a(n) = 2^(1 + number of zeros in binary expansion of n).
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
example: 12 = 1100 in binary, which contains two 0's, so a(12) = 2^3 = 8.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 17 2016
